intro: Hydora lithuanica, commonly known as the Lithuanian waterweed, is a flowering plant native to wetland and aquatic environments in Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae and is characterized by its submerged or floating leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in shallow waters, often forming dense mats that provide habitat for aquatic life. Its rhizomes are fibrous and help anchor it in muddy substrates, while its reproductive structures are adapted for water dispersal. Hydora lithuanica plays a crucial role in maintaining water quality and supporting biodiversity in its native ecosystems.
